ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: the strong one who appeared on the uppermost horizon.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And he was on the horizon of the highest heaven.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: While he was in the highest part of the horizon,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And he is in the highest part of the horizon.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: When he was on the uppermost horizon.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: standing poised at the highest point on the horizon,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: While he was on the uppermost horizon.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: while he was on the highest horizon.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: While he was in the highest part of the horizon:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: While he [Jibrael (Gabriel)] was in the highest part of the horizon,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: while he was in the highest horizon;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: While he was at the highest horizon.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: While he was in the higher [part of the] horizon.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [53:7]   when he was on the highest horizon, the horizon of the sun, that is to say, at the place from which it rises, in the form in which he [Gabriel] was created, so that the Prophet (s) saw him; he [the Prophet] had been at [Mount] Hirā’, where Gabriel had obscured the entire horizon to the west. The Prophet fell down swooning, after he had asked him [Gabriel] to show himself to him in the form in which he was created. Thus Gabriel had made a tryst with him at Hirā’, where he came down to him in human form.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (When he was on the uppermost horizon) at the setting place of the sun; and it is said: at the seventh heaven.
